intro: Sphaeralcea tripartita, commonly known as the three-part globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has hairy, glandular leaves that help reduce water loss. Its fruit is a spherical capsule that splits open to release seeds, and it plays a role in supporting local pollinators. Sphaeralcea tripartita is often found in open areas such as grasslands and disturbed soils.
